title: Local boy shot in hunting accident
content:
A 13-year-old boy is in stable condition after he was accidentally shot while on a hunting trip outside McAlester this weekend, according to the Pittsburg County Sheriff’s Department.
The boy’s name was not released by authorities. Pittsburg County Sheriff Joel Kerns said all indications are the shooting was an accident.
“Right now we are operating as an accidental shooting,” Kerns said.
Pittsburg County Sheriff’s Deputy Micah Stites is assigned to the investigation. Stites said he is working with Oklahoma Game Warden Shane Fields on the investigation.
“We got the call yesterday,” Stites said. “The party involved — they went to move some weapons around (in a truck) and there was an accidental discharge.
“No one fired the weapon,” Stites added. “It is going to be ruled as a hunting accident.”
The weapon discharged was a deer rifle and the accident occurred just west of McAlester in the Haywood/Arpelar area, Stites said.
“They were out hunting and when they went back to the vehicle a gun was moved and (the discharge) went through the rear door and struck the victim,” Stites said.
Authorities received the call about the accident at approximately 10:15 a.m.
